thread.title: What's Happening With These Specialty Chemicals Stocks? -- Albemarle, Chemours, W.R. Grace, and Kronos Worldwide

author: cnbc.com
title: What's Happening With These Specialty Chemicals Stocks? -- Albemarle, Chemours, W.R. Grace, and Kronos Worldwide
text:
NEW YORK, January 25, 2018 /PRNewswire/ --
WallStEquities.com strives to bring the best free research to the investment community. Today we are offering reports on ALB, CC, GRA, and KRO which can be accessed for free by signing up to www.wallstequities.com/registration . The global Specialty Chemicals market size was estimated at USD 1.16 trillion in 2016 and is projected to grow at a CAGR of 5.6% from 2017 to 2025, according to a report published in June 2017 by Grand View Research. High demand for function-specific chemicals owing to transitioning consumer and industrial product life cycles has fostered industry growth in recent years, the report further noted. Pre-market today, WallStEquities.com covers the recent performance of the following stocks: Albemarle Corp. (NYSE: ALB), The Chemours Co. (NYSE: CC), W.R. Grace & Co. (NYSE: GRA), and Kronos Worldwide Inc. (NYSE: KRO). All you have to do is sign up today for this free limited time offer by clicking the link below.
www.wallstequities.com/registration
Albemarle
On Wednesday, shares in Charlotte, North Carolina headquartered Albemarle Corp. saw a slight decline of 0.53%, ending the day at $112.40. The stock recorded a trading volume of 2.73 million shares, which was above its three months average volume of 1.49 million shares. The Company's shares have advanced 17.63% over the past year. The stock is trading below its 200-day moving average by 7.79%. Moreover, shares of Albemarle, which develops, manufactures, and markets engineered specialty chemicals worldwide, have a Relative Strength Index (RSI) of 24.77.
On January 18 th , 2018, Albemarle announced that Matt Juneau, Executive Vice President, Corporate Strategy & Investor Relations, is retiring in March 2018, and that the Company has named Eric W. Norris as Chief Strategy Officer, effective immediately. In his new role, Norris will be responsible for both Corporate Strategy and Investor Relations. Get the full research report on ALB for free by clicking below at:
www.wallstequities.com/registration/?symbol=ALB
Chemours
Shares in Wilmington, Delaware headquartered The Chemours Co. ended the day 1.45% lower at $52.99 with a total trading volume of 1.89 million shares. In the last month and over the past year, the stock has gained 8.10% and 107.89%, respectively. The Company's shares are trading above their 50-day and 200-day moving averages by 4.41% and 12.91%, respectively. Furthermore, shares of Chemours, which provides performance chemicals in North America, Asia/Pacific, Europe, Middle-East, Africa, and Latin America, have an RSI of 54.74.
On January 18 th , 2018, Chemours announced that it will release Q4 and full-year 2017 financial results after market close on February 14 th , 2018. The Company will conduct its webcast conference call on February 15 th , 2018, at 8:30 a.m. EST. The live webcast of the call will be available under the investor page of the Company's website. Today's complimentary research report on CC is accessible at:
www.wallstequities.com/registration/?symbol=CC
W.R. Grace
At the close of trading on Wednesday, shares in Columbia, Maryland headquartered W.R. Grace & Co. finished 0.31% higher at $74.35 with a total trading volume of 519,714 shares. The stock has advanced 5.76% in the last month, 5.55% over the previous three months, and 5.52% over the past year. The Company's shares are trading above their 50-day and 200-day moving averages by 3.30% and 4.37%, respectively. Additionally, shares of W.R. Grace, which produces and sells specialty chemicals and materials worldwide, have an RSI of 60.95.
On January 18 th , 2018, W.R. Grace announced that it will release its Q4 and full-year 2017 financial results on February 08 th , 2018, at 6:00 a.m. ET. A Company-hosted conference call and webcast will follow at 9:00 a.m. ET that day. The live webcast and accompanying slides will be available under the Investor section of the Company's website. Register now for your free research document on GRA at:
www.wallstequities.com/registration/?symbol=GRA
Kronos Worldwide
Dallas, Texas headquartered Kronos Worldwide Inc.'s shares recorded a trading volume of 279,172 shares at the end of yesterday's session. The stock closed the day 1.38% lower at $27.81. The Company's shares have advanced 5.94% in the past month and 111.16% over the past year. The stock is trading above its 50-day and 200-day moving averages by 3.37% and 26.19%, respectively. Additionally, shares of Kronos Worldwide, which produces and markets titanium dioxide pigments in Europe, North America, Asia/Pacific, and internationally, have an RSI of 53.51. Click on the link below and see our free report KRO at:
www.wallstequities.com/registration/?symbol=KRO
--
